_header: This ender night / When stars shone bright
Subjects: chansons d’aventure ; dialogues, Christ and man; Christ, love to sinners
_description: A dialogue between Christ and the Sinner, with chamson d’aventure opening — two six-line tail-rhyme stanzas and nineteen couplets

VandADyce45.First Lines:
Thys enders nyteWhen sterres shone bryteMy selfe walkyng
                    aloneI herde one cryeMoste pytouslyAnd sore he made hys
                    moneTo christe Iesussaying as thushave mercye vpon meAnd
                    then I herdehowe chryste answeredand sayde what troblethe
                    the…
VandADyce45.Last Lines:
…Wilte thou hyt grawnte ye trwlyO good lorde then grawnte hyt
                    meAmen Iesus ffinis
